body.p: supports syntax highlighting in XML documents to make it easier to read the semantics of the structured content by displaying each type of XML code in different colors and fonts.

To customize the colors or styles used for the syntax highlighting colors for XML files, follow these steps:
.
Go to Editor Syntax Highlight .
Select and expand the XML section in the top pane.
Select the component you want to change and customize the colors or styles using the selectors to the right of the pane.
Select the XML tab in the Preview pane to see the effects of your changes.
body.note: also allows you to specify syntax highlighting colors for specific XML elements and attributes with specific namespace prefixes. This can be done in the Editor Syntax Highlight Elements/Attributes by Prefix preferences page.
